utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in here?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've had this cough for over a week now, and it just hasn't gone away.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh, so this cough has been going on for a week. Can you describe the cough a little bit for me?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so I mean sometimes I produce sputum and sometimes I don't. It's uh, white and whiteish clear in color.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, and it's been going on for more than a week.Has it been getting worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It got a little bit worse at first, but then it's been kind of the same, um, since.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you noticed at all, um, like green or yellow color of your sputum or any blood tinged sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, No blood, and maybe a little yellowish.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, little yellowish, OK. And how much would you say you bring up, um, on an average day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, a couple of teaspoons.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Couple of teaspoons OK.OK, has there been anything that um, makes it worse or better?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nothing that I can think of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had this happen to you previously in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And is the cough uh, constant or does it come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It comes and goes, uh, throughout the day. No particular time of the day it's worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and, um, are you having any, uh, other symptoms besides the cough, um, like shortness of breath,sore throat, um, runny nose, congestion, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh. yeah, I've had, um, a sore throat, uh, and a headache, as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when did the sore throat start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, that started about five days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Five days ago? And has it been getting worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, that's been about the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And do you have any difficulty, uh, swallowing at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's a little sore, but, uh, it's been OK, to eat and drink.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you noticed any kind of redness in your throat or any swelling around your neck?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I took a look in the mirror as best I could with my phone and I couldn't really notice anything that looked red.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about the headache? When did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: So it's been, uh, kind of off and on over the past, uh, week or so. Um, feels like a like a pressure sensation and my head is just really squeezing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and um. So is it on one side of your head or both sides?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Both sides.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And it's Kind of like a pressure and squeezing. Is it at all pulsating?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? OK, Is it constant or does it come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It comes and goes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you taken any medications to make any of these symptoms better?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I have used some Advil for the headaches and over the counter medicine at night time to help sleep.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uh,and do you recall doing anything in the last few weeks which you might believe that Uh, caused some of these symptoms? like for example, were you in contact with anyone that was sick at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Well, I'm a nursing student and I've been on rotations in the hospital recently.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And anyone that you probably saw in the hospital, anyone sick that you were in contact with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I did see some people who had, like, infectious symptoms.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and other than that, have you been having any fevers or chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've felt chills.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK chills, and when did you feel them?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've been feeling chills throughout the day and at night, I just feel like I can't get warm even with a blanket on.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you taken your temperature at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah, we can do that for you today. Uh, other than that any recent travel outside of the province.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, been just at school.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any loss of sense of taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No,

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and When did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just over this past week I've been really tired, I've been been needing naps and not feeling rested in the morning.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any chest pain at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, It does feel sore, kind of, uh, the center of my chest.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so any coughing at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I feel it, like more, like it does hurt when when I'm coughing, that's kind of what I'm feeling it. I think it's being caused by how much I'm coughing.I kind of feel it there in the center.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And besides, when you're coughing, do you have any pain in your chest when you're breathing in or out?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No,

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? OK. Alright, any changes to your bowel movements, like any Constipation or diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any urinary issues?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes with your sleeping or your appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you noticed any significant weight loss in the last few weeks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's been the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you recently, prior to your coughing, have you had any infections like a viral illness or like a cold for example, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, now that I think about it, I mean, maybe like a month ago I had like a runny nose for a couple of days and it just went away.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, were you on any kind of medications or antibiotics at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, just went away on its own pretty quickly.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, do you have any past medical conditions, like high blood pressure, diabetes, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't, I'm healthy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you take any medications regularly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any hospitalizations or surgeries in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any family history of any lung or heart conditions or any cancers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think my mom has high blood pressure, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. I forgot to ask you this earlier. Have you been experiencing any wheezing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah I have noticed a bit of a wheeze, yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And currently you are nursing student. Where do you live?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live with a couple of my classmates downtown.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you live in an apartment or dorm, a house?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: An apartment.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, anyone sick in your household at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nobody's been sick.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you drink alcohol at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sometimes with friends, on a weekend.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you smoke cigarettes at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And any recreational drugs like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, so yeah those are all the questions I had for you. Do you have any questions or concerns?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I was just hoping to feel better. It's been going on for so long now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You said it's more than a week now, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so what we will do today is, uh, first of all, with the pandemic going on, with some of these symptoms, we need to rule out coronavirus. And so we will be getting a swab done for you as well today and considering you are having these symptoms, we will also get another test done for you today to see if there's any bacteria causing what we call walking pneumonia. It's community acquired pneumonia that's fairly common in like the younger population. And so we'll see if you could have that. And so from there we'll see if we need to put you on any antibiotics which will help you. And if we need to get any blood work or X Rays we'll let you know as well. Is that OK? And if you feel like you have worsening symptoms like shortness of breath, you need to make sure you come back to the Emergency Department.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that sounds great. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, you're welcome and take care, and we'll get all those things done for you and we'll be with you shortly.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, sounds good.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
